context: 1. repair of cleft soft palate, cpt 42200.
2. excise accessory ear tag, right ear.
the right ear tag was examined first. this was a small piece of skin and cartilaginous material protruding just from the tragus.
the patient was placed supine on the operating room table.
the face was prepped and draped in a sterile fashion.
the lesion was excised and injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine and then excised using an elliptical-style incision.
the lesion was excised and injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine and then excised using an elliptical-style incision.
the dingman mouthgag was inserted and the palate was injected with 0.25% bupivacaine with epinephrine.
after giving this 5 minutes to take effect, the palate was incised along its margins.
the anterior oral mucosa was lifted off and held demonstrating the underlying levator muscle.
the z-plasties were then designed, so there would be opposing z-plasties from the nasal mucosa compared to the oral mucosa.
the nasal mucosa was sutured first using interrupted 4-0 vicryl.
following this, the oral layer of mucosa was repaired using an opposing z-plasty compared to the nasal layer.
in addition, the remnant of the uvula tissue was found and was sutured in such a place that it would add some extra bulk to the nasal surface of the palate.
suction of blood and mucus performed at the end of the case.
